div.p: Greetings. I sent the letters or a copy of the letters with a certain peasant named Hans Pfenninger from Uerikon. Now Captain Meiss comes, with whom I have discussed all the matters; he thinks there is nothing to worry about. Therefore, you may make less of it; however, it does no harm to take good care. You will understand everything from Meiss.
It is certain that the seeds of the Venetian war have been sown. Chur, in the evening before Christmas.
To the most distinguished man, Heinrich Bullinger, the most vigilant pastor of the Church of Zurich, his master.
